alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; Rolette (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 15 at 7:59AM CDT until August 15 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Bottineau County in north central North Dakota... Northern Rolette County in north central North Dakota... * Until 900 AM CDT. * At 759 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lake Metigoshe State Park, or 13 miles northeast of Bottineau, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... International Peace Garden around 815 AM CDT. St. John and Belcourt around 850 AM CDT. Rolla around 900 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Shell Valley. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Metigoshe, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
